I dunno, I've seen those 12 accurate Montana shells wreck cruisers and DDs more than any other BB.

I think they are all strong. Yamato still has the best guns, being able to pen everything through the nose is always useful. Kurfurst has hydro and turtleback making it the hardest to kill without torps, Montana has the best concealment, maneuverability, and gun accuracy which I think people underestimate when played well.
But all of them have proper weaknesses. Yamato gets stuck bow on and HE spamed, Kurfurst can't turn and is bigger than the maps, Montana has the lowest caliber and shell velocity.
High tier cruisers are great, if any cruisers are in a bad spot it's T6 and below.
I agree USN DDS could get their torps reduced, but most of them play close since their gunboats, and sniping BBs lose whereas torp sniping Shimas won.

It's clear WG wanted to remove long range torping as a viable tactic because it does not provide very interactive gameplay. In an effort to bring IJN DDs closer to the fight, we have what we're getting nkw. Time will tell how viable they have become, but a bunch of salty dogs miss the torpedo soup gameplay.
Good luck shitting on a 20k HP DD that can stealth fire from 9km.

No, the line is splitting into anti DD gunboats then reworked torpedo boats afaik. If WG just moves some ships around and dials back the torp detection, viola. The line becomes insanely better. Then a skill like keen intuition is gonna be one of the few real tools you can use vs stealth torping.

IJN DDs are also getting a rework soon so I am holding judgement until we see how they change. Keen Intuition is good in very specific situations which is pretty pricey for a tier 4 skill as other skills are constantly good in multiple situations (CE, AFT, MA MS)

People have said torpedos have been killed over and over and yet they're still viable. DDs have been nerfed over and over and are still yet hugely influential over battles. Radar was added, people thought it was the end of DDs. If you look at the latest ranked season though, it tells a different tale.
Keen intuition will be good late game in 1v1, but knowing a DD is right in front of you won't stop torps hitting your nose.

USN CAs are much more situational. They are very good at bullying certain ships they are good against and providing support in the form of Radar and AA. I find myself abusing terrain much more in USN CAs than any other cruisers. And without torps, you need to stay around you concealment range. You can only really yolo agaisnt another cruisrr or something that you can takr on bow forward. Most of the time you don't want more than one or two ships able to shoot at you.
KM CAs are much more well rounded and have different tools that allow them to handle different situations. The general playstyle for them however is to stay around your concealment range 12-14km and snipe with HE and AP while dodging shells as best you can. Both are solid at T9+. I actually found myself shooting HE most of the time and only going AP when the situation really called for it. The amazing hydro and torps gives more yolo potential but the higher tier you get, the less yolo you're gonna be able to do. You shouldn't be going for yolo unless it's way late in the match really.
My opinion is the T9/T10 KM CAs are the most fun cruisers in the game. Pro tip, run DE/CE and both steering gears mods.
No shit, 8x is an insane amount of AA. Use like 2x or soemthing lol.
In my experience, Hindenberg can get away with steering gears. It doesn't matter if you're spotted when you can win a fight vs anything.
Wargaming is making so much money with this game.

Cool concept. I think it would be much more viable as a gameplay addition if it was something like "reports the distance of all ships within 15km." So it won't reveal any ships location still, but you can use it know how danger close you are to a DD or a radar cruiser or soemthing.
They might also make it to where you have to have researched the Iowa already. Would make sense if they want to keep it out of as many noob hands as possible (for a T9, they should).
I think they probably did. But they probably justify it by it being punished so harshly for misplays.

IJN- focus on stealth gameplay and ambushes. Reliable solo and DD escorts role.
USN- going to be excellent vs RN cruisers.
KM - Hindenburg is the best/most fun ship in the game. IMO, of course. There's always going to be broadsides to punish. HE isn't the best but your rate of fire at T9/10 is so strong it doesn't matter. You'll set plenty of fire.
VMF- Long range spam because of poor maneuverability. Radar is the strongest with team play.
RN - Plays like DDs. Getting into good smoke positions, best concealment, constantly moving into flanks on their sides, torps. You'll like if you like DDs.
Just adding some more stuff you didn't mention. Maybe it'll push you one way or another.
I checked this last night and both flags increased my secondary fire chance on Scharnhorst. Didn't check any other ships.
